content: Which French artist, known for his paintings of ballet dancers, created the artwork 'L'Absinthe'?

The French artist known for his paintings of ballet dancers and who created the artwork 'L'Absinthe' is Edgar Degas. Degas was a prominent figure in the Impressionist movement, although he preferred to be called a Realist. He is particularly famous for his depictions of dancers, as well as scenes from modern life, including café scenes like 'L'Absinthe.' This particular painting portrays a woman sitting at a table, drinking absinthe, appearing withdrawn and melancholic, which was a subject that Degas explored in several of his works.
